decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Mystic Forge combo, which allows the player to generate huge amounts of mana and card advantage by casting artifacts from the top of their library. Cards like Paradox Engine and Voltaic Key help untap mana rocks for more activations, while cards like Karn, the Great Creator provide additional utility with artifacts in the sideboard. The deck aims to accelerate its game plan with fast mana sources like Grim Monolith and Urza's lands, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful artifacts and combos.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Jace. Stoneforge Mystic helps to search for key equipment like Batterskull and Kaldra Compleat to gain advantage on the battlefield. The inclusion of Psychic Frog provides additional card advantage and disruption for the opponent. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's powerful spells and ensure smooth gameplay. With a mix of control elements and threats, the deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through superior strategy.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's strategy by consistently playing powerful aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Goblin Rabblemaster. Utilizing cards like Blood Moon and Sundering Eruption to disrupt the opponent's mana base while dealing damage. The deck aims to quickly close out the game with powerful creatures and efficient removal spells. The inclusion of cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide allows for explosive starts, while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Vexing Bauble provide card advantage and utility. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats and disrupt their game plan.

The main goal of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining tempo advantage through efficient spells and creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Force of Will to control the board, as well as creatures like Psychic Frog and Brazen Borrower to apply pressure, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory. The deck also includes disruptive lands like Wasteland and Nihil Spellbomb to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on proactive plays and disruption to maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this Merfolk Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Harbinger of the Seas, Silvergill Adept, and Lord of Atlantis, while disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the game with cards like Tide Shaper and Vodalian Hexcatcher, while also utilizing Aether Vial to cheat out creatures. The inclusion of True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult to deal with threat, while also benefiting from tribal synergies with other Merfolk creatures. The deck's focus is on tempo and aggression, aiming to overwhelm opponents before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana with Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and Ancient Tomb to play powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and It That Heralds the End. The deck utilizes disruption spells like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command to control the board and prevent opponents from developing their game plan. Wasteland and Glaring Fleshraker provide additional disruption and the ability to deal with problematic lands. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, powerful creatures and disrupt their strategy to secure victory.

The focal point of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly disrupt and overwhelm the opponent through aggressive plays and locks. By utilizing cards like Blood Moon and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to hinder the opponent's mana base while deploying powerful threats like Pyrogoyf and Sundering Eruption. The deck also includes fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate its game plan. The inclusion of dragon creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Headliner Scarlett further reinforces the aggressive nature of the deck, aiming to close out games swiftly.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Devourer of Destiny and Glaring Fleshraker, backed up by disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It also utilizes powerful lands like Wasteland and Eye of Ugin to outpace and outmaneuver opponents. By ramping up quickly and overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats, this deck aims to close out games quickly and decisively. With a mix of Eldrazi creatures and versatile spells, this deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan and push through for a quick victory.

The main concept of this Legacy control deck is to disrupt and counter opponent's spells while efficiently drawing cards and ramping up mana. The deck includes powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, along with disruption tools like Stifle and Commandeer. It also includes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Consider to maintain card advantage. The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering threats, disrupting opponent's plays, and eventually closing out the game with powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Hooting Mandrills.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures and removal spells. By using countermagic like Force of Will and Daze, along with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Nihil Spellbomb, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plays. The aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf help to close out the game quickly once the opponent's defenses have been weakened. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and additional disruption, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and recover. Overall, this deck aims to tempo out the opponent and win through early aggression and disruption.
